title: Collinear and Coplanar Points
description: A four-panel diagram showing examples and non-examples of collinear and coplanar point arrangements for geometry education.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Mathematics - Geometry
topic: Foundations of Geometry - Points, Lines, and Planes
learningObjectives: Analyze point arrangements to determine whether sets of points are collinear or coplanar
Distinguish between examples and non-examples of collinear points
Identify coplanar points in 2D and 3D representations
Understand that three or more points lying on the same line are always collinear
Recognize that four or more points may or may not be coplanar
prerequisites: Understanding of basic geometric terms (point, line, plane)

accessibility.description: Four-panel diagram showing examples and non-examples of collinear and coplanar points

assumptions: 2D representation of 3D concepts for panels 3 and 4
Grid lines help visualize planes in 2D space
limitations: Panel 4 uses perspective projection to represent 3D space in 2D
